intro: Sphaeralcea angustifolia var. cuspidata, commonly known as narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
